title: Women's Premier League 2024:  Get Ready for a More Competitive Season!
content:
The second edition of the Women's Premier League (WPL) is set to be even more thrilling, with the defending champions, Mumbai Indians, facing off against the runners-up, Delhi Capitals, on February 23rd.  

The tournament will see a more competitive field with exciting new signings and replacements like Chamari Athapaththu and Nadine de Klerk.  The WPL serves as crucial preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup, offering valuable game time and a chance for overseas players to acclimatize to subcontinent pitches.

The WPL 2024 will be played across two legs in Bengaluru and Delhi, with all 22 matches scheduled for the evening.  Get ready for intense competition, exciting matches, and the chance to see who will challenge last year's Orange Cap and Purple Cap winners, Meg Lanning and Hayley Matthews!
author: Scroll Staff
